answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Understand your predicament. Your symptoms of blurred vision, headaches and dizziness could be due to the blocked artery. Therapy for the blocked artery depends on where  the block is and if any collateral circulation is there. It also depends on your present symptoms and other systemic conditions like diabetes or hypertension. Please discuss the various options with your consulting doctor.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: Hi im a 38 yr old women i had an mri as I've been having blurred vision headache and dizziness vertigo symptoms and it showed that one of the arterys to the back of my brain is blocked plz help im so scared im a single mum to 3 kids one of them only 3 yrs old with heart problems have i got a risk of having a stroke now important waiting to see neuro just wondered if any of u have anything to put my mind at ease i cant sleep find myself watching everything i do darnt even turn my neck fully :(
title: Diagnosed blocked vertebral artery
